item.title: How to Create Qr Code for a Page in Microsoft Edge
item.description: There are just 3 steps to create a QR code for a website or in page in Microsoft edge. Step 1 : Browse any website you like to convert to a QR code. Step 2 : On the website, right click on the page and go to “Create QR cpde for this page”. Step 3 : Lastly, download or scan the QR code. Apart from creating a QR code for the page you are currently on, you can edit the URL before downloading and put a new URL of your choice and then download to your device or scan.

item.title: How to add sitemap to your site using netlify plugin
item.description: You are done building your website but you need an automatic way of generating sitemap for your website without having to do much work. Here is a simple guide on how to do just that. Note. Your website has to be built with plain old HTML or any SSG (Static Site Generator) such as Hugo, Gatsby, 11ty etc. and also must be uploaded to Netlify. You need to go to your Netlify dashboard Click on the Integrations tab On the integration dashboard, click on the search bar and type “sitemap” Then, click on enable The sitemap plugin prompt “install” will appear After clicking the install botton, you will be redirected to the dashboard.

item.title: how to know the color of any image on firefox browser easily
item.description: Here is how to use Firefox browser Eyedropper to get the color of any image or text on the web Go to your Firefox browser or open any page you will like to get color from Click on the menu bar and then click on more tools Click on Eyedropper Lastly the eyedropper will appear with the hex code showing below it
